description: Enterprise techniques used by Tropic Trooper, ATT&CK group G0081 v1.0
name: Tropic Trooper (G0081)

techniques.comment: [Tropic Trooper](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0081) installs a service pointing to a malicious DLL dropped to disk.
[Tropic Trooper](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0081) used letmein to scan for saved usernames on the target system.
[Tropic Trooper](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0081) has detected a target system’s OS version.
[Tropic Trooper](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0081) used netview to scan target systems for shared resources.
[Tropic Trooper](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0081) used pr to scan for open ports on target systems.
[Tropic Trooper](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0081) has been known to side-load DLLs using a valid version of Windows Address Book executable with one of their tools.
[Tropic Trooper](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0081) has executed commands through Microsoft security vulnerabilities, including CVE-2017-11882, CVE-2018-0802, and CVE-2012-0158.
[Tropic Trooper](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0081) has injected a DLL backdoor into a file dllhost.exe.
[Tropic Trooper](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0081) uses SSL to connect to C2 servers.
[Tropic Trooper](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0081) sent spearphishing emails that contained malicious Microsoft Office attachments.
[Tropic Trooper](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0081) has created a hidden directory under C:\ProgramData\Apple\Updates\.

[Tropic Trooper](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0081) delivered malicious documents with the XLSX extension, typically used by OpenXML documents, but the file itself was actually an OLE (XLS) document.
[Tropic Trooper](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0081) used shellcode with an XOR algorithm to decrypt a payload.
[Tropic Trooper](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0081) creates the Registry key HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon\Shell and sets the value to establish persistence.
[Tropic Trooper](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0081) can use ports 443 and 53 for C2 communications via malware called TClient.
[Tropic Trooper](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0081) enumerates the running processes on the system.
[Tropic Trooper](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0081) searches for anti-virus software running on the system.
